inequality has fallen across most of the distribution in the last decade after substantial increases in earnings dispersion in the period from 1993 to 2011. over the whole period, there has been only a small rise in inequality due to shifts in the lower half of the income distribution (captured by the 50:10 ratio) but moderate increases in the 90:10 ratio, with gross individual earnings at the 90th percentile being more than eight times higher than income at the 10th percentile in 2019 (compared to a ratio of roughly 6 in 1983).
